info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 02 at 4:47PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Intense snow showers will impact portions of northeastern Mineral, northwestern Lake, northwestern Missoula, southeastern Sanders and southwestern Flathead Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 446 PM MDT, trained weather spotters reported intense snow showers along a line extending from 22 miles west of Big Arm to near De Borgia. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Visibility one-half mile or less and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Low visibility could result in dangerous driving conditions. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Polson, Plains, Jette, Turtle Lake, Kings Point, Rocky Point, Kerr, Paradise, Big Arm, De Borgia, Hot Springs, Round Butte, Weeksville, Perma, Elmo, Finley Point, Niarada, Dayton, Lonepine and Camas Prairie. This includes Highway 93 between mile markers 54 and 83. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
